data.chText: 措辞巧妙的能力；风趣；才思
data.enText: the ability to say or write things that are both clever and amusing

data.chText: 才思敏捷；敏锐机智；假装正经的诙谐；头脑机敏
data.enText: to have a quick/sharp/dry/ready wit

data.chText: 才思敏捷、聪颖的女子
data.enText: a woman of wit and intelligence

data.chText: 一本有关他30年政治生涯中才思与智慧的书
data.enText: a book full of the wit and wisdom of his 30 years in politics

data.chText: 才思敏捷说话诙谐的人；机智幽默的人
data.enText: a person who has the ability to say or write things that are both clever and amusing

data.chText: 一位闻名遐迩、妙语连珠的故事大王
data.enText: a well-known wit and raconteur

data.chText: 理解力；颖悟力；头脑；智力
data.enText: your ability to think quickly and clearly and to make good decisions

data.chText: 他需要绞尽脑汁找到出路。
data.enText: He needed all his wits to find his way out.

data.chText: 这场游戏是长时间的斗智。
data.enText: The game was a long battle of wits .

data.chText: 凯特停下来恢复一下理智。
data.enText: Kate paused and gathered her wits .

data.chText: 利用你的智慧同我们的知识竞赛冠军进行较量的机会
data.enText: a chance to pit your wits against (= compete with, using your intelligence) our quiz champion

data.chText: 有…智慧的；头脑…的
data.enText: having the type of intelligence mentioned

data.chText: 一群头脑聪明的学生
data.enText: a quick-witted group of students

data.chText: （正确判断的）能力，智力；明智
data.enText: the intelligence or good sense to know what is the right thing to do

data.chText: 你起码还能意识到要求救。
data.enText: At least you had the wit to ask for help.

data.chText: 解决这一纠纷应当是人力所能及的事。
data.enText: It should not be beyond the wit of man to resolve this dispute.
be at your wits' end

data.chText: 智穷计尽；全然不知所措
data.enText: to be so worried by a problem that you do not know what to do next
be frightened/scared/terrified out of your wits

data.chText: 吓得魂不附体
data.enText: to be very frightened
have/keep your wits about you

data.chText: 时刻保持头脑冷静；随机应变
data.enText: to be aware of what is happening around you and ready to think and act quickly
to wit

data.chText: 也就是说；即
data.enText: you use to wit when you are about to be more exact about sth that you have just referred to

data.chText: 飞行员的失误，即没有遵守操作程序，是事故的原因。
data.enText: Pilot error, to wit failure to follow procedures, was the cause of the accident.
live by your wits

data.chText: 靠耍小聪明赚钱；（有时）靠玩花招捞钱
data.enText: to earn money by clever or sometimes dishonest means

word_means: 才思敏捷说话诙谐的人

means: 才思敏捷说话诙谐的人

ex.chText: 他非凡的智慧助他取得巨大的成功。
ex.enText: His brilliant mind contributed to his great success.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指人的思维或感知、想象等能力，无褒贬之意。

ex.chText: 如果你有点脑子，你就会知道接下来要做什么。
ex.enText: If you had any brains, you'd know what to do next.

ex.chText: 他想找一份不需要动太多脑筋的工作。
ex.enText: He wanted to find a job that didn't require too much brains.

synonyms.bx: 指能理解思考和快速学习的能力，通常用复数。

ex.chText: 你的孩子从小就显示出了很高的智力水平吗？
ex.enText: Did your child show high intelligence from an early age?

ex.chText: 在他看来，只有秀外慧中的女子才能成为他的妻子。
ex.enText: In his opinion, only a woman who has both beauty and intelligence can be his wife.

synonyms.bx: 指学习、理解、思维、判断等的能力，也指聪明、聪慧。

ex.chText: 他需要绞尽脑汁逃离重兵把守的小岛。
ex.enText: He needed all his wits to escape from the heavily guarded island.

ex.chText: 第一条建议就是要随机应变。
ex.enText: The first piece of advice is to keep your wits about you.

synonyms.bx: 指思维敏捷并能作出正确判断的能力，强调机敏，通常用复数。

data.enText: be at your wits' end

data.chText: 智穷计尽；全然不知所措
data.enText: to be so worried by a problem that you do not know what to do next
be frightened/scared/terrified out of your wits

data.chText: 吓得魂不附体
data.enText: to be very frightened
have/keep your wits about you

data.chText: 时刻保持头脑冷静；随机应变
data.enText: to be aware of what is happening around you and ready to think and act quickly
to wit

data.chText: 也就是说；即
data.enText: you use to wit when you are about to be more exact about sth that you have just referred to

data.chText: 飞行员的失误，即没有遵守操作程序，是事故的原因。
data.enText: Pilot error, to wit failure to follow procedures, was the cause of the accident.
live by your wits

data.chText: 靠耍小聪明赚钱；（有时）靠玩花招捞钱
data.enText: to earn money by clever or sometimes dishonest means

example: he's got plenty of brains but no common sense

tr: a message whose ingenuity or verbal skill or incongruity has the power to evoke laughter
a witty amusing person who makes jokes

value.def: Wit is the ability to use words or ideas in an amusing, clever, and imaginative way.

example.ex: Boulding was known for his biting wit...
example.tran: 博尔丁爱说尖酸的俏皮话是出了名的。

example.ex: They love her practical attitude to life, her zest and wit.
example.tran: 他们喜欢她务实的人生态度、她的热情和幽默。

value.def: If you describe someone as a wit, you mean that they have the ability to use words or ideas in an amusing, clever, and imaginative way.

example.ex: Holmes was gregarious, a great wit, a man of wide interests.
example.tran: 福尔摩斯爱交际,非常风趣，兴趣广泛。

value.def: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation.

example.ex: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
example.tran: 资料就摆在那儿，等着有头脑的人去利用。

value.def: You can refer to your ability to think quickly and cleverly in a difficult situation as your wits .

example.ex: She has used her wits to progress to the position she holds today.
example.tran: 她凭借个人才智升到了今天的职位。

value.def: You can use wits in expressions such as frighten someone out of their wits and scare the wits out of someone to emphasize that a person or thing worries or frightens someone very much.

example.ex: You scared us out of our wits. We heard you had an accident.
example.tran: 你把我们吓坏了，我们听说你出事了。

example.ex: ...a huge bass drum which frightened the wits out of the organist each time it was banged.
example.tran: 每次敲起来都让风琴师惊慌失措的巨型低音鼓

value.def: If you have your wits about you or keep your wits about you, you are alert and ready to act in a difficult situation.

example.ex: Travellers need to keep their wits about them.

value.tran: 时刻保持警惕;随机应变

value.def: If you say that you are at your wits' end, you are emphasizing that you are so worried and exhausted by problems or difficulties that you do not know what to do next.

example.ex: We row a lot and we never have time on our own. I'm at my wit's end.
example.tran: 我们经常争吵，从无在一起的时间，我真是没有办法了。

value.tran: 智穷才尽;黔驴技穷;无计可施

value.def: If you pit your wits against someone, you compete against them in a test of knowledge or intelligence.

example.ex: He has to pit his wits against an adversary who is cool, clever and cunning.
example.tran: 他不得不与一个冷静、聪明而又狡猾的对手斗智。

value.def: To wit is used to indicate that you are about to state or describe something more precisely.

example.ex: He'd like 'happiness' to be given a new and more scientifically descriptive label, to wit 'Major affective disorder, pleasant type'.
example.tran: 他想给“幸福”一个更为科学的新称谓，准确地说即“愉悦型重度情感障碍”。

value.tran: （用于更准确地描述）亦即，也就是

trans: （用于更准确地描述）亦即，也就是
